settings.text: Designed in collaboration with fashion and style experts, Lucinda Chambers and Serena Hood, the Chinti & Parker x Collagerie capsule collection is a curation of eight carefully-considered styles you’ll wear again and again.

settings.grid-content:
Our conversation with Lucinda and Serena...

What is your favourite piece from the collection?

Lucinda...

I have to say I love it all and would wear every piece with pleasure and pride! If I had to choose one, it would probably be the striped knitted dress. With a high boot or running around town in a trainer, this is hard to beat. I love the fact that it is cosy personified but chic at the same time.

Serena...

Admittedly I love it all too, it’s hard to pick just one piece! The “cardigan” is definitely a forever piece , and incredibly versatile perfect for both city and country life. In fact, I have my eye on both colours.

What was your inspiration for this collection?

We started with colour. As we do quite a lot of things. What would each be our favourite colours to wear. What was brilliant is that when we put them together, they really worked. We also wanted to design things that could easily and happily work together like a fabulous jigsaw.

Why did you choose to collaborate with Chinti & Parker?

Chinti and Collagerie is a good fit. Serena and I have always worn C and P over the years and love their use of colour also the quality is always great.

settings.text:
Where will you be wearing the new collection?

Lucinda...

Pretty much everywhere, you can dress it up or down, it’s very versatile in that way.

settings.grid-content:
Where will you be wearing the new collection? 

Serena...

What’s so wonderful about this collection is that it works in many ways. I’ll be wearing it everywhere too, from the office, to meetings around town, to just relaxing at home in the cashmere joggers.

Do you have any styling tips for us?

Look at your skin tone and see which colour ways are the most flattering for you. The skirt flares beautifully so a slouchy high boot is great with this. The dresses look fantastic with a clashing colour trainer or a chunky sole boot.

Also, I love to add a pair of flat front flared trousers, usually in white or cream, under knitted dresses. They lengthen the silhouette and make it more personal at the same time.

The collection all works perfectly together, but you can also weave each piece into your wardrobe effortlessly. The pink and beige polo neck looks amazing with a vintage Prada skirt I have, and am already plotting when and where to go in that.
